author: terencechain
content: Currently, eip7732 may disrupt some staking pool setups where the fee recipient is a contract address that automatically splits fees between operators. Given that epbs payments are consensus-based as stated today, they could use payload.withdrawals_request instead right?

author: terencechain
content: For bid cancellation, I learned today that the majority of builders rely on cancellation. I wouldn't support it for P2P. For RPC, I think we would want the proposer to sign the get header request, and the builder would want to allow one get header request per proposer. That should address the cancellation concern from the builder's point of view, right?

author: potuz
content: I don't think cancellation is even relevant in a context where the proposer is likely to only ask once when they are about to propose. If proposers start deviating from vanilla behavior for timing games/advertising bids, etc. Builders are free to not serve any more bids or keep several if they want to

author: terencechain
content: Yeah. I think the difference here is builder is familiar with push based system today but needs to move to a pull based system. If it worres proposer may be constantly pulling then just serve the first bid
